p: We assume the landscape is divided into a simple 5 by 4 grid of identical habitat patches, where patch size is defined as the scale over which adult mosquitoes migrate. Because of the relatively short flight range of adult Aedes mosquitoes [ 38], we assume that mosquitoes disperse only among adjacent patches, with equal probability ( S1 Table). We assume humans are mobile enough at the spatial scale of the model that a mosquito in any patch can bite any human (but see [ 36] for analyses in which this assumption is relaxed). The time scale of the model is such that we assume a fixed human population (no human birth or death).
